question: Which country was the location of the Nemean Games?
explanation: The Nemean Games were one of the four Panhellenic Games of Ancient Greece and were held at Nemea every two years (or every third). With the Isthmian Games, the Nemean Games were held both the year before and the year after the Ancient Olympic Games and the Pythian Games in the third year of the Olympiad cycle. Like the Olympic Games, they were held in honour of Zeus.
